review: I like the concept and so far the actual stick seems like a pretty solid device.  The setup was brain dead simple which was nice. I ordered mine from Amazon directly and it came "pre registered" and linked to my account. I am not sure if I like that or not.  What if it had been purchased as a gift? Perhaps I missed that option.  What is a bit disappointing is the availability of movies and shows.  I signed up for the Prime trial but honestly the selection of material available is pretty lacking.  Hopefully that will improve.

review: WARNING!! Amazon touts this as an improved alternative to Chromecast. It is NOT. Chromecast is a way to stream videos from PC or mac to your TV. It also streams anything (i.e. Netflix) that you can get on your Chrome browser.Fire Stick does NOT stream your already owned videos from your PC. In addition, it is set up to push as much advertising as possible via "apps" to BUY, BUY, BUY from Amazon. Even the little blt of streaming it does requires you to use Amazon Cloud storage, which is only free for the first 5 gigs (a pittance when it comes to storing videos.) I wasted 2 hours trying to get it to stream before contacting Amazon and finding out that "it doesn't do that." I also wasted time downloading firestick apps such as "watch Disney" which is only a workaround if you already HAVE Disney from your TV provider. Clunky, inelegant and sneaky.
